author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: سَلْطَنَتِكَ، أَيْ ربِّ كُلٌّ مُتَرَصِّدٌ إِلى شَطْرِ جُودِكَ وَمُتَوَجِّهٌ إِلى أُفُقِ فَضْلِكَ لا تَحْرِمْهُمْ بِإِحْسَانِكَ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ بِسُلْطانِكَ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ المُهَيْمِنُ القَيُّومُ.
translation: Their eyes, O my Lord, are expectantly turned in the direction of Thy bounty, and their faces are set towards the horizon of Thy grace. Suffer them not, through Thy bounty, to be deprived of Thy grace. Potent art Thou, by Thy sovereign might, over all things. No God is there but Thee, the Almighty, the Help in Peril, the Self-Subsisting.
